definition: to intensify/to speed up/to step up
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
tight/strict/close at hand/near/urgent/tense/hard up/short of money/to tighten

sentences.english: Perak, Malaysia is currently the police are stepping into the cause.
sentences.chinese: 目前马来西亚霹雳州警方正在加紧调查事故的原因。

sentences.english: The government tightened up economic controls.
Juventus are stepping up their push for Lazio fullback Massimo Oddo.
sentences.chinese: 尤文正在加紧追赶拉奇奥右后卫奥多的步伐。

sentences.english: The White House has also stepped up its efforts to shepherd the bill through the Senate.
sentences.chinese: 白宫也已经加紧努力，游说在参议院通过该法案。

sentences.english: Now, Congress is revving up ahead of a high-stakes hearing.
sentences.chinese: 国会正加紧筹备一场攸关重大的听证会。

sentences.english: She said that taking advantage of a good light now, we should accelerate the completion of this huge paper-cutting.
sentences.chinese: 她说，趁着现在光线好，要加紧完成这一巨幅剪纸。

sentences.english: I must press on with my work because it is late.
sentences.chinese: 我必须加紧干这活，因为天晚了。

sentences.english: That big boy is always cajoling other children into doing things for him.
sentences.chinese: 那个大男孩老是哄骗加紧的孩子为他做事。

sentences.english: He's stepping up writing his new novel.
sentences.chinese: 他正在加紧写作他的新小说。

sentences.english: The construction crew's just finishing it up.
Intensive efforts to understand the virus and develop a vaccine begin immediately.
sentences.chinese: 加紧努力了解病毒和立即开始研发疫苗。

sentences.english: so we got to originate the parts that we played.
sentences.chinese: 所以我们要加紧创作我们自己的那部分。

sentences.english: Yangpu to Haikou, also stepped up to create a one-hour road traffic circle .
sentences.chinese: 洋浦还在加紧打造至海口的一小时公路交通圈。

sentences.english: We require our order urgently, so please expedite shipment.
sentences.chinese: 我方急需这单货物，速请加紧装船发货。

sentences.english: The China Banking Regulatory Commission recently accelerated research and investigation on affordable housing construction.
sentences.chinese: 银监会最近加紧了对保障住房建设的研究和调查。

sentences.english: Legitimate drug companies say China must toughen up its regulations on exported drugs.
sentences.chinese: 合法的制药公司说中国必须加紧它对出口药物的管理。

definition: to grasp firmly/to pay special attention to/to rush in/to make the most of
to snatch time/to rush/to hurry (up)/to seize the moment
to try harder/to redouble one's efforts
to accelerate/to speed up
pace/tempo/degree of progress (on project)/work schedule
with all one's strength/full strength/all-out (effort)/fully (support)
to put one's hand to it/to start out on a task/to set out
fundamentally complete/basically finished
just at (that time)/right in (that place)/right in the middle of (doing sth)
as quickly as possible/as soon as possible/with all speed
see 儘快|尽快[jin3 kuai4]
pressing in on one's eyelashes (idiom); imminent
to spur the horse to full speed (idiom)/to go as fast as possible
to work against the clock/to hurry with work to get it done in time
like wildfire (idiom)/unstoppable
to impel/to carry forward/to push on/to advance/to drive forward
to increase (e.g. one's effort)
